meanings.definition: The quality or state of being divided into two parts or classifications.
meanings.sent1: The dichotomousness of the decision left us with only two choices.
meanings.sent2: Her belief in the dichotomousness of good and evil made her see the world in extremes.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomousness of cats and dogs is a funny topic for debate.
meanings.sent4: The dichotomousness of the political landscape became more apparent as the election drew near.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the concept of dichotomousness to explain the simple division of the animal kingdom into vertebrates and invertebrates.

meanings.definition: The tendency to view things as either black or white, with no middle ground.
meanings.sent1: His dichotomousness in opinions made it hard to find common ground.
meanings.sent2: The dichotomousness of her thinking prevented her from seeing the nuances in the situation.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomousness of his fashion sense always led to interesting outfit choices.
meanings.sent4: The dichotomousness of the artist's work reflected the inner conflict he felt.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomousness of the weather forecast predicted either rain or sunshine, with no in-between.
